definition: lost letter/letter containing news of sb's death
letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random

sentences.english: Time was when monitoring a suspected dead-letter box involved laborious work by humans.
sentences.chinese: 过去，监视一个可疑死信投递点全靠人力艰苦作业。

sentences.english: The message is placed in the sending queue manager's Dead Letter Queue.
sentences.chinese: 该消息会放入发送队列管理器的死信队列中。

sentences.english: You do not create a journal or dead-letter queue.
sentences.chinese: 不应创建日记或死信队列。

sentences.english: However, newly created queue managers are not configured to use a dead letter queue.
sentences.chinese: 但是，新建队列没有配置为使用死信队列。

definition: letter written in one's own blood, expressing determination, hatred, last wishes etc
to send word/to deliver a letter
to forward (a message, letter, article etc)
to announce sb's demise/to predict death
inside front cover (sometimes refers to both inside front and inside back covers)
